meanings.sent1: The spruce tree stood tall in the forest.
meanings.sent2: I love the fresh scent of a spruce tree.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel made its home in the spruce tree.
meanings.sent4: The spruce tree's branches reached for the sky like outstretched arms.
meanings.sent5: The green needles of the spruce tree shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: She always looks so spruce in her clean uniform.
meanings.sent2: The room was spruce and organized for the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat groomed itself to look spruce for the visitors.
meanings.sent4: His spruce attire made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The freshly painted fence looked spruce against the green grass.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something neat and tidy in appearance.
meanings.sent1: She would spruce up the house before guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: He decided to spruce up his resume before applying for the job.
meanings.sent3: The gardener worked hard to spruce up the neglected garden.
meanings.sent4: They planned to spruce up the old car with a new coat of paint.
meanings.sent5: A fresh coat of paint can really spruce up a room.
